net.photopay.view.viewfinder

Class AbstractViewFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.photopay.view.viewfinder.AbstractViewFinder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutofocusStatusView

    public abstract class AbstractViewFinder
extends java.lang.Object
implements AutofocusStatusView

    • Method Detail

      • onSizeChanged

        public void onSizeChanged(int width,
                 int height)
        This method is called before layouting rotatable and fixed view. This also happens every time view orientation change occurs. The reported width and height are corrected for orientation (in landscape mode width is actually height and vice versa). You can use this method for example for adjusting dynamic margins of your views.
        Parameters:
        width - new width of the layout
        height - new heigth of the layout

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(Orientation orientation)
        This method is called whenever view orientation change occurs. Although you don't need to adapt rotation of the view you return with getRotatableView, this method is kept for backward compatibility and for cases when you want to be aware of device orientation change even in your fixed view.
        Parameters:
        orientation - new screen orientation

      • setCameraPreview

        public final void setCameraPreview(CameraPreview cp)
        Sets the camera preview which is the owner of this viewfinder. This camera preview is used to invoke camera controls, such as request autofocus and turn torch on/off.
        Parameters:
        cp - camera preview object

      • isCameraFocused

        public final boolean isCameraFocused()
        Returns:
        true, if camera is in focus

      • getCameraType

        public final net.photopay.hardware.camera.CameraType getCameraType()
        Returns the currently opened camera's type (front facing or back facing). If no camera is opened, returns null.
        Returns:
        currently opened camera's type or null

      • focusCamera

        public final void focusCamera()
        Requests camera to perform autofocus. If camera does not support autofocus feature, method does nothing.

      • isCameraTorchSupported

        public final boolean isCameraTorchSupported()
        Returns true if camera supports torch flash mode.
        Returns:
        true if camera supports torch flash mode.

      • setTorchEnabled

        public final boolean setTorchEnabled(boolean enabled)
        If torch is supported, set its state to enabled (on), or disabled (off).
        Parameters:
        enabled - if true and camera supports torch, torch will be enabled
        Returns:
        true, if operation was successful, otherwise false

      • setUsingOnlyBarcode

        public final void setUsingOnlyBarcode(boolean onlyBarcode)
        This method is called to indicate whether only barcode scanning will be performed. With this information, viewfinder can adapt its appearance for barcode-only scanning.
        Parameters:
        mOnlyBarcode - If true, only barcode scanning will be performed. If false, both barcode scanning and OCR scanning or only OCR scanning will be performed.

      • isOnlyBarcode

        public final boolean isOnlyBarcode()
        Returns true if only barcode scanning will be performed. You can call this method in derived classes to adapt your UI for either barcode or OCR scanning.
        Returns:
        true if only barcode scanning will be performed

      • setProgressModifier

        public final void setProgressModifier(ProgressModifier modifier)
        This method is called to set appropriate progress modifier for current scan. Progress modifier can be used to recalculate current progress of scan.
        Parameters:
        modifier - Progress modifier

      • showRawProgress

        public final void showRawProgress(int progress)
        This method is called as a notification about scan progress. If progress modifier is set, it is used to modify scan progress. Finally, showProgress is called to display progress.
        Parameters:
        progress - Current scan progress from interval [0, 100]

      • showProgress

        protected void showProgress(int progress)
        This method is called as a notification about scan progress. Default implementation does nothing. This method is called from background thread. Do not perform UI operations directly in this method, instead use Handler.
        Parameters:
        progress - Current scan progress from interval [0, 100].

      • setDefaultTarget

        public void setDefaultTarget(int detectionStatus,
                    boolean showProgress)
        This method is called to notify viewfinder that it should position itself into its default position. Default implementation does nothing. This method is called from background thread. Do not perform UI operations directly in this method, instead use Handler.
        Parameters:
        detectionStatus - The status of detection as defined in RecognizerDelegate
        showProgress - True if progress should be displayed on screen.

      • startProgressAnimation

        public void startProgressAnimation()
        This method is called to notify viewfinder that it should start drawing progress animation. Default implementation does nothing. This method is called from background thread. Do not perform UI operations directly in this method, instead use Handler.

      • setRecognizerMode

        public void setRecognizerMode(int mode)
        This method is called to notify viewfinder in which operating mode is scanning started. Default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        mode - Recognizer operating mode: can be RecognizerSettings.RECOGNITION_MODE, RecognizerSettings.RECOGNITION_TEST_MODE or RecognizerSettings.DETECTION_TEST_MODE

      • setNewTarget

        public void setNewTarget(Point uleft,
                Point uright,
                Point lleft,
                Point lright,
                int uleftIndex,
                int detectionStatus,
                boolean showProgress)
        This method is called to notify viewfinder that object has been detected so that it can draw itself around that object. Corner points of detected slip are presented via parameters uleft, uright, lleft and lright. Those parameters are corner points of the payment slip that are closest to the real edges of the screen. For example, uleft is the corner point of the slip that is closest to the (0,0) coordinate - it does not have to be the actual upper left corner of the slip. Parameter uleftIndex can be any integer from 0 to 3 and defines a real upper-left edge of the slip (if it is 0, then upper left is given with uleft parameter, if it is 1, then upper left is given with uright parameter etc.). Points coordinates are normalized (coordinate range is from interval [0.0, 1.0]) and placed in image-based coordinate system. The (0,0) coordinate in the image-based coordinate system is the coordinate of the first pixel in image - first pixel in first row. If you are holding your phone in landscape mode, the image-based upper left (coordinate (0,0)) corner will be the same as device's upper left corner. If you are holding your phone in portrait mode, the image-base upper left corner will be the same as device's upper right corner. Default implementation does nothing. This method is called from background thread. Do not perform UI operations directly in this method, instead use Handler.
        Parameters:
        uleft - Upper left position of the object's box.
        uright - Upper right position of the object's box.
        lleft - Lower left position of the object's box.
        lright - Lower right position of the object's box.
        uleftIndex - Which of given points is actual upper left point of object (in case of rotated image).
        detectionStatus - The status of detection as defined in RecognizerDelegate
        showProgress - True if progress should be displayed on screen.

      • setPointSet

        public void setPointSet(float[] points,
               boolean biColorPointSet)
        This method is called to notify viewfinder that object has been detected so that it can draw point of interest for this object. Default implementation does nothing. This method is called from background thread. Do not perform UI operations directly in this method, instead use Handler.
        Parameters:
        points - Array of coordinates for points of interest. Coordinates are packed in following way: x1,y1,x2,y2,...
        biColorPointSet - If true, this means the caller requested that odd points should be drawn in one color and even points in another color.

      • getRotatableView

        public android.view.View getRotatableView()
        This method is called when adding viewfinder on top of camera surface. This method should return view that will be overlayed on camera. The view returned in this method will be automatically rotated when device orientation changes. If you do not want to rotate your UI, simply return null here and return your fixed UI in method getFixedView. Of course, you can return both fixed and rotatable view - in this case, rotatable view will be overlayed on top of fixed view which will be overlayed on top of camera surface. Default implementation returns null.
        Returns:
        View that should be overlayed on camera.

      • shouldAnimateRotation

        public boolean shouldAnimateRotation()
        You should return true in this method if you want your rotatable UI to be animated while performing a rotation. Default value is false. Note that on some devices animating the rotation sometimes causes draw corruption - this is the reason why is the default return value false.
        Returns:
        true if rotatable view should be animated while rotating, otherwise false.

      • getRotationAnimationDuration

        public int getRotationAnimationDuration()
        If you have rotatable view and have enabled rotation animation, you can return animation duration in miliseconds by overriding this method. Default value is 250.
        Returns:

      • getFixedView

        public android.view.View getFixedView()
        This method is called when adding viewfinder on top of camera surface. This method should return view that will be overlayed on camera. The view returned in this method will not be rotated when device orientation changes. If you want to rotate your UI, simply return null here and returned your rotatable UI in method getRotatableView. Of course, you can return both fixed and rotatable view - in this case, rotatable view will be overlayed on top of fixed view which will be overlayed on top of camera surface. Default implementation returns null.
        Returns:

      • getInitialOrientation

        public Orientation getInitialOrientation()
        This method is called when rotatable view is being layouted on top of camera UI (provided that getRotatableView returns non-null). Method should return the initial orientation to which rotatable view will be rotated when initializing the view for the first time.
        Returns:
        the initial required orientation of the rotatable view

      • shouldPutInsideCameraSurface

        public boolean shouldPutInsideCameraSurface()
        If method returns true, views obtained with getFixedView and getRotatableView will be layouted inside camera surface. If method returns false, views will be layouted over whole CameraPreview view. Default implementation returns true.

      • displayMessage

        public void displayMessage(java.lang.CharSequence text)
        Viewfinder should display given message. This method is called from background thread. Default implementation uses Handler to invoke displayMessageImmediately on UI thread. Do not perform UI operations directly in this method, instead use Handler.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to be displayed.

      • displayMessageImmediately

        public void displayMessageImmediately(java.lang.CharSequence text)
        Viewfinder should display given message. Unlike displayMessage, this method is called from UI thread, so you can perform UI operations directly in this method. Default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to be displayed.

      • displayDebugStatus

        public void displayDebugStatus(java.lang.CharSequence text)
        Viewfinder should display given debug message. Default implementation does nothing. This method is called from background thread. Do not perform UI operations directly in this method, instead use Handler.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to be displayed.

      • displayAutofocusFailed

        public void displayAutofocusFailed()
        Description copied from interface: AutofocusStatusView
        This method will be called when camera focusing has failed. Camera manager usually tries different focusing strategies and this method is called when all those strategies fail to indicate that either object on which camera is being focused is too close or ambient light conditions are poor.
        Specified by:
        displayAutofocusFailed in interface AutofocusStatusView

      • isAnimationInProgress

        public boolean isAnimationInProgress()
        This method should return true if it wants to prevent finishing the activity while some animation is in progress. Default implementation returns false.
        Returns:
        true if animation is in progress
